The Scole Experiment chronicles the extraordinary results of a five-year investigation into life after death. At the beginning of 1993 four psychic researchers embarked on a series of experiments in the Norfolk village of Scole. The subsequent events were so astounding that senior members of the prestigious Society for Psychical Research asked to observe, test and record what took place.


http://www.thescoleexperiment.com/
awsome, thanks for the extra info/link:) you go the exstra mile, axxo for tv-shows^^
Sounds awesome... thank you :-) Will seed.

The Scole "'report" simply doesn't hold up and wouldn't under the scrutiny of a 5 year old.
The investigators were not allowed to impose any controls on the mediums whereas they in turn had to bend to the demands put on them by the mediums. 

It merely highlighted the growing need in the technological age for these frauds to somehow appear methodical or scientific, when in truth, anyone showing even the slightest sceptical tendencies was excluded from the "experiment".

Even the SPR try to distance themselves from the whole affair these days.

Still, this doc does show what lengths of desperation the group would go to to try and "prove" the existence of ghosts or the afterlife, yet in truth after 5 years they were left with absolutely nothing tangible.

I found it stupendously one-sided as it even starts off on the incorrect premise that the experiments were a) scientific in nature and b) provided irrefutable scientific evidence. 

Frankly I feel docs like these do very little for serious paranormal research whatsoever. There is no balance, no analysis and absolutely zero science. Just the members of the group trying to flog a dead horse.
